alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:24AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gibson and western Pike Counties through 200 AM CDT/300 AM EDT/... At 124 AM CDT/224 AM EDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Patoka, or near Princeton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Princeton around 130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oakland City and Petersburg. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 31 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT/500 AM EDT/ for southwestern Indiana.
